Articles.Content:
For this challenge, you have to get into orbit using just SRBs!

Probably VERY HARD!

I'm working on it myself!

IF you land on the mun, I'll be amazed!

GL&HF!

I assume you mean "using just SRBs" means using them as the only source of thrust and not as the only parts on your vessel, as you would need a probe core or command pod to launch at all.

I doubt this would be a difficult challenge at all since you can control thrust and fuel amounts in the VAB.

EDIT: It was pretty easy to get to orbit and even get back home safe. Minor changes to your flight profile will have a big impact on your final orbit though. I had to do a de-orbit burn at an unusual place in the orbit in order to not put the periapsis too low.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Edited September 4, 2015 by Kelderek
I think I've seen on the threads somewhere, someone who did a Mun return mission on SRB's only.

I've been doing it wrong!

You were thinking different!

I was trying to use the largest SRBs to get to orbit and back.

I never tried the small ones except for my attempted retrograde burn.

And THAT ended in me being krakened for some reason.

I did this a long time ago as tribute to LADEE mission.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I think I've seen on the threads somewhere, someone who did a Mun return mission on SRB's only.

That might have been me

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Hazard-ish did a Laythe landing and return in 0.90..no one has beat that record yet I think.

The initial challenge of getting into orbit is easy, my 8 part offering is below.

http://imgur.com/gallery/Ve7BV/new

My re-entry is steep, but it would easily be survivable if I hadn't warped so long.... smashing Bob into Kerbin

Difficulty for SRBs will come from precision, mostly transferring to other SOIs and landings. It can be done as seen above, but its a little beyond my patience!

Edited September 5, 2015 by ghpstage
